result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Walter Kysilka

records.addlTxt: 11:42 AM Defendant Charles Walter Kysilka in court with attorney Christian J Ness apears by video.  Defendant Charles Walter Kysilka in custody.  Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.    Plea Questionnaire eletronically submitted to Court.  Attny Ness indicates plea questionnaire review with DEF via telephone.  DEF agrees, Court proceeds with plea/sentencing.  State recites agreement, all parties agree.    As part of the agreement, Case is dismissed and read in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

 Attny Ness request to be set for plea/sentencing date.  Court set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

09:07 AM Defendant Charles Walter Kysilka in court with attorney Christian J Ness.  Defendant Charles Walter Kysilka in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances.  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2021 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on November 2, 2021 at 08:45 am.

11:04AM Defendant Charles Walter Kysilka in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with attorney Christian J Ness.  Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case (15CM415, 15CT75) and recites appearances.  Atty Ness indicates offer received, requests PLEAS be set.  Court informs parties INIT has not been completed.  Parties agree to complete INIT at this time.    DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court enters NG plea for misdemeanor on behalf of DEF.  All parties have discussion on setting prelim (in 15CT75).  Atty Ness indicates waiver of time limits in 15CT75, DEF agrees.  Court sets prelim for 15CT75 for 11/2/21 at 8:45AM and STC for 15CM416 for same date and time.  Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2021 at 08:45 am.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 19, 2021 at 11:00 am.

Combination Bond:  15CT75 & 15CM416 -- 

CBS $10,000  Do not drive without a valid drivers' license.    ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

Sortedahl appeared appearing by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court quashes warrant.  Court reviews case, notes case has been in warrant status for 6 years.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Ness argues bond.  Court sets bond.
